li.a: Basic Instructions for Parents - Virtual Assignments
Ohio Parent Information and Resource Center

strong.span: has been postponed to August 3 for Utica Elementary students and August 4 for Newton Elementary students. More information regarding scheduling will be provided at a later date. Thank you.

div.span: A Message from the Technology Department Regarding Zoom
regarding graduation requirements in light of school building closures due to the Coronavirus.

p.span: On Monday, March 30, 2020, Governor DeWine announced that schools will continue with the closure until May 1, 2020, due to the coronavirus. He indicated that at that time they will evaluate the direction for all K-12 schools.

span.style: line-height: 14.399999618530273px; font-weight: bold; font-size: 12px; text-decoration: underline;font-family:Tahoma

p.span: Students should already have their work for the week of March 30, 2020.)
We will continue with our virtual learning plans. Staff will continue to create lessons for each of the weeks we are missing face-to-face instruction.

div.span: The Ohio Department of Health has activated a call center for COVID-19 that is open 7 days a week from 9:00 a.m. - 8:00 p.m., and the number is 1-833-427-5634.

span.text-node: , the state has developed a new website dedicated to COVID-19, which will be the best location to find information regarding the virus in Ohio.
